description.narrative: Tanzania - Energy Sector Project: Increase economic activity by improving electricity service through several activities: installing a 100 MW submarine transmission cable from the mainland to Zanzibar; constructing approximately 2,700 kilometers of distribution lines in seven regions, and upgrading substation infrastructure; providing solar photovoltaic systems in Kigoma; providing technical assistance.

title.narrative: Measuring Results of the Tanzania Distribution System Rehabilitation and Extension Activity
Measuring Results of the Tanzania Kigoma Solar Activity
Measuring Results of the Tanzania Zanzibar Interconnector Activity

condition.narrative: 1) Prior to initial Disbursement for the Energy Sector Project, an Electricity Act, agreeable to stakeholders including MCC, shall be enacted and in full force and effect.

2) Prior to initial Disbursement for the Energy Sector Project, the Government shall support TANESCO's corporate objective of moving towards financial self-sufficiency through, at the minimum, tariff reform that reflects full cost recovery.

3) Prior to initial Disbursement for Energy Sector Project, the Government shall ensure that independent and professional members constitute a majority on the board of directors of TANESCO, which shall include private sector representation.

4) Prior to initial Disbursement for the Energy Sector Project, the TANESCO shall submit to EWURA a rate case that recovers full operating cost (i.e at least the sum of cost of sales, operating expenses and debt service).

5) Prior to initial Disbursement for construction for any Project Activity under the Energy Sector Project, any required feasibility and design study, EIA, environmental assessment, and RAP, shall be completed to MCC satisfaction, and the implementation of any required RAP (including full payment of resettlement compensation in compliance with the World Bank Policy on Involuntary Resettlement (OP 4.12) shall be completed.

6) Prior to initial Disbursement for construction for any portion of any Project Activity under the Energy Sector Project, the implementation of all applicable resettlement activities, including provision of resettlement compensation as set forth in the applicable RAP shall be completed for such portion.

7) Prior to the Disbursement for the Energy Sector Project covering the quarter beginning July 1, 2009, TANESCO shall submit to EWURA a rate case that recovers full cost (i.e at least the sum of cost of sales, operating expenses, debt service and capital expenditures (which shall at least equal asset depression expense).
Further details on conditions precedent affecting this activity can be found in the top-level parent activities.

description.narrative: Level Output of Baseline as well as target value are both based on average across all Mainland regions, similarly data given by TANESCO reflects performance over all the regions.
